Posts.Content: I get a sore throat about 5 days after chemo , it lasts 2-3 days, after 1st chemo went to GP who gave me antibiotics as a precaution, but i now know its side effect from chemo,
Posts.Title: Lost my voice

Posts.Content: Hi all 4 days since 1st FEC feeling great, have completed the 3 days of meds, now just have Maxolon, not had any today. Hope it continues, god is goodX
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, start my chemo on the 14th Sept, thanks for advice, am giving the cold cap a whirl X
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi happy mum , this is my first cycle, not as bad as i expected, some nausea on and off, feel better since lansoprazole as kept getting "acidity" when i ate. Just eating what i fancy, prior to diagnosis, lost 3.5 stone with s w, thats how i found lump , boobs less dense. On antibiotics as had sore throat, but as a precaution, just be vigilant re getting infections and check your temperature, i am an ex nurse so may be a bit more paranoid and make a poor patient x
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, had 1st FEC on Thurs(am not having the T part) used Paxman cold cap machine, it felt like an ice vice for first 10 minutes until i got used to it . Chemo went well, i drank lots of water pre and post and took frozen grapes to suck when being given drugs, so far so good. Downside was nausea kicked in 2 hours later, on and off in waves, even had to sit up  Thurs into Fri morning, thankfully by late morning yesterday had subsided, so far so good Praise God X
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi happy mum, yes i am having FEC (not the T) I have been out and about but careful to avoid lots of people. The chemo was ok, i was worried that i would experience "a strange sensation" in my body , as i don't like to feel out of control, but i was fine , everyones experience is different , i hope all goes well for you X
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Just looked at Heathershair, wow think i may be getting one. Just back from GP, due to sore throat , now on antibiotics also Lansoprazole as having some "acidy" issues, got a bit of a sore mouth as well, hope it all settles, today is day 8 post FEC chemo x
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear this Sylvie64 and hope you are feeling much better❤️ , got my first FEC on Thursday, wish me luck☘️X
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: I used cold cap, it seemed to fit well but i kept resting my hand over the crown to ensure max cooling as i had read this is where hair can shed first due to ill fitting cap, so fingers crossed x
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi Sylvie64, sorry to hear this, i have had a few dodgy days with lethargy and low mood, hope all goes well with bloods and you get the next round. My scalp has been so itchy at times and a few little spots, only one week today since chemo, no hair loss YET ! X
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *
